business.headline: Donald Trump launches $TRUMP meme coin, crypto traders make millions in minutesDonald Trump, days before his presidential inauguration, shook the crypto market with the launch of $TRUMP meme coin, which surged 220 per cent in value and hit USD 4.25 billion in hours.
IMF forecasts India's growth at 6.5% for fiscal year 2025-2026IMF maintains India's growth at 7% for 2024-2025 and 6.5% for 2025-2026, driven by investment and consumption.

8th Pay Commission: What were the big changes in 7th and 6th Pay Commissions?The Government has approved the formation of the 8th Pay Commission for central government employees and pensioners. Here is a look at the salary hikes under the 7th and 6th Pay Commissions.

5 simple tips to get personal loans at lowest interest ratesThis article guides you through five effective strategies to secure personal loans at the most competitive interest rates, ensuring you make informed financial decisions and reduce your overall borrowing costs.

Why 8th Pay Commission is spurring calls for income tax relief in BudgetWith government employees set to benefit from a pay hike from the 8th Pay Commission, private sector employees are demanding income tax relief to boost their disposable income. Experts argue that easing the tax burden on individuals is key to spurring consumption, the backbone of India's economic growth.
Sensex ends over 400 points lower, Nifty falls as IT stocks tumbleThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 423.49 points lower at the closing bell, whil the NSE Nifty50 settled 108.60 points lower at 23,203.20.
How long before 8th Pay Commission benefits reach central government employees?The 7th Pay Commission took around 22 months from its formation to the implementation of its recommendations.

Is artificial intelligence the new wolf of Wall Street?A recent Bloomberg Intelligence report stated that major Wall Street banks, including Citigroup, JPMorgan, and Goldman Sachs, may slash up to 200,000 jobs in the coming 3-5 years.
Bad credit? Here's how you can still secure emergency fundsThough bad credit limits borrowing options and raises interest rates, some lenders still offer loans.
Is EPF to NPS transfer possible? Check the details hereThe decision to transfer EPF to NPS must align with your financial goals, liquidity needs, and risk appetite.

8th Pay Commission: How much salary increase can government employees expect?Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw confirmed the decision and said that the commission would be formed soon to revise the pay structure for central government employees and pensioners.
Will India's growth story gain momentum or slow down in FY26?India's GDP, which clocked a stellar 9.7% in FY22 before settling at 7% in FY23 and 8.2% in FY24, has been on a roller-coaster ride.

Axis Bank shares drop 6% to hit 52-week low. Should you buy? Axis Bank share price: The stock closed at Rs 1,040.20 in the previous session, opened at Rs 1,006.95 on Friday and slid further to Rs 974.45 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

8th Pay Commission: What is fitment factor that determines salary hikeThe salary and pension hikes under the 8th Pay Commission will be calculated by applying the fitment factor to the existing basic pay.
Reliance share price rises over 2% after Q3 results. Should you buy now? Reliance's share price was up 1.44% to Rs 1,287 at 10:51 am on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
Explained: Why Infosys share price tumbled over 5% after strong Q3 resultsInfosys stock was down 5.40% at Rs 1,822.10 on the BSE at 10:15 a.m. The company's shares had hit a day's low of Rs 1,815.85.

Sensex drops 750 points. Why did stock market fall in early trade?Stock market down today: The fall in IT stocks was a result of Infosys' shares falling over 5.3% after the company reported its Q3 results yesterday. The drop, however, came as a surprise as the company raised its revenue forecast.

Sensex drops 400 points: Markets tank as IT stocks fall; Infosys down 5%Stock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 430.02 points to 76,612.80, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 121.05 points to 23,190.75 as of 9:22 AM.

Donald Trump plans to make cryptocurrency a national priority: ReportThe order will designate cryptocurrency as a national imperative, encouraging government agencies to collaborate with the industry.

RIL shares in focus today post Q3 results: 5 things investors need to know RIL posted a 12% year-on-year (YoY) increase in consolidated net profit to a record Rs 21,930 crore for the third quarter of financial year 2024-25 (FY25).

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Saif Ali Khan's attacker arrested, evidence suggests he's Bangladeshi: CopsThe man, who stabbed actor Saif Ali Khan, was arrested from Thane. Documents seized from the accused suggest that he was a Bangladeshi national and entered India five-six months ago.

TikTok goes offline in US ahead of ban on video-sharing appSeveral screenshots of the app shared on social media showed a message on the short-video platform stating that a law banning TikTok had been enacted, with the message, "You can't use TikTok for now."

Saif Ali Khan's attacker previously visited actor's home for cleaning: SourcesSaif Ali Khan's attacker, Mohammad Shariful Islam Shehzad, had visited the actor's home before and had worked at a housekeeping firm, according to sources.

Trump lands in Washington ahead of inauguration, fireworks kickstart celebrationsDonald Trump will host a reception for about 500 guests and a fireworks display on Saturday night, ahead of the inauguration of his second term.

What's drawing the Gen Z to Maha Kumbh 2025A large number of youngsters are participating in Maha Kumbh 2025, effortlessly blending social media with spirituality. This is what is attracting the Gen Z to the Kumbh Mela, a religious gathering that is believed to draw the spiritually-inclined and the elderly.

Shashi Tharoor blames KCA for Sanju Samson's absence from Champions Trophy squadCongress MP Shashi Tharoor has blamed Kerala Cricket Association (KCA) for Sanju Samson's snub from the Champions Trophy 2025 squad.

You're not fashion designer: RJD slams Nitish Kumar over women's dress remarkRJD leader Tejashwi Yadav took a dig at Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar for his remarks on the sartorial choices of women in the state, saying he was not a "fashion designer".

Dinners with Trump, JD Vance get costlier for donors; minimum price at $50,000Donors are required to contribute at least $1 million to the inauguration committee--the highest-tier ticket package -- to get access to Trump and JD Vance, a sharp increase from the previous cycle, when the same access cost $500,000.

A sky full of stars: Coldplay's spectacular first concert in MumbaiColdplay Mumbai concert review: Watching Chris Martin interact with fans—reading out placards, wishing people happy birthday, or just thanking fans in Hindi—made it feel like he genuinely cared about everyone.

Day 8 Live Updates: Alcaraz begins 4th round clash, Gauff seals comeback winAustralian Open 2025, Day 8 Live Updates: A fantastic effort from Coco Gauff as she overcame adversity to win the match against Bencic in 3 sets. After losing the first one, Gauff used her serve to good effect and secured the win. Alcaraz has begun his 4th round clash against Jack Draper at the Rod Laver Arena.

Centre-farmers' talks on February 14, Jagjit Dallewal accepts medical aidThe Centre agreed to hold a meeting with the protesting farmers on February 14 in Chandigarh, following which farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, on an indefinite fast for 54 days, agreed to take medical aid.

No Gaza ceasefire unless Israel gets list of hostages to be released: Netanyahu33 of the 98 remaining Israeli hostages kidnapped by Hamas are expected to be freed in this phase of the ceasefire deal mediated by Qatar. In exchange, Israel will also free around 2,000 Palestinians who are currently lodged in multiple prisons.

When tech meets tradition: How AI is revolutionising Maha Kumbh 2025Tight security measures are in place in Prayagraj to manage the gathering of millions of people who have come to attend Maha Kumbh from across the world.

Why BJP's Delhi election campaign is all about Arvind KejriwalThe party is projecting Kejriwal as having debased from his anti-corruption-activist image into a leader accused of financial irregularities and duping voters with unviable freebies

Ex-IPS officer recalls incident that left him 'frozen'. His post has a strong messageA former Indian Police Service (IPS) officer shared an incident from his early days in service that left him completely "frozen".

Watch: Coldplay's Chris Martin says 'Jai Shri Ram' during Mumbai concertColdplay's Chris Martin said 'Jai shri Ram' during their Mumbai concert today, sending the audience into a tizzy. The British band also enthralled the audience with a Hindi greeting and performance on their chartbusters.

Cry for help or attention? How to deal with someone who is sadfishing youAccording to mental health experts, individuals with borderline personality traits, those with fewer social friends than virtual friends, and people mostly glued to the digital world are more likely to sadfish on social media.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

South Korean court extends President Yoon's detention, protests eruptLast week, Yoon Suk Yeol Yoon became the first sitting South Korean President to be arrested as he faced allegations of insurrection related to his stunning, short-lived December 3 declaration of martial law that has plunged the country into political turmoil.

Rajasthan minister blames 'love affairs' behind student suicides in KotaRajasthan Education Minister Madan Dilawar blamed "love affairs" as the reason behind student suicides in Kota, where four students have ended their lives so far this year.

Trump's inauguration: Celebrities, world leaders, notable absences - a full listDonald Trump will be sworn in as the 47th US President on January 20. The inauguration will feature celebrities, world leaders, and notable absences like Russian President Vladimir Putin and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

AAP couldn't deliver 3 promises, will fulfill if re-elected: Arvind KejriwalArvind Kejriwal said that the AAP couldn't deliver on three promises in Delhi, the cleaning of the Yamuna river, providing clean drinking water and making Delhi's roads of European standard.

SpaDeX docking experiment a success, will pave way for future missions: Isro chiefPraising the team for the successful docking of SpaDeX satellites, Isro chief V Narayanan said the mission would pave the way for future missions like Chandrayaan 4 and Gaganyaan.

India-China ties trying to disentangle from post-2020 border issue: S JaishankarWhile addressing an event in Mumbai, S Jaishankar advocated for enhancement of India's comprehensive national power to address border challenges effectively.

Mumbai girl Shradha Mishra wins singing reality show Sa Re Ga Ma PaMumbai's Shradha Mishra lifted the coveted winner's trophy of this season's Sa Re Ga Ma Pa. She defeated Subhasree Debnath and Ujwal Motiram Gajbhar, who ended as the first and second runners-up, respectively.

sports.headline: On This Day: India breached Gabba fortress to win Border-Gavaskar TrophyRishabh Pant was the star of the run chase as India breached the Gabba fortress to secure a historic and memorable win against Australia in Brisbane on January 19, 2021. This helped India win the Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2-1.

Mohammad Rizwan sledges Kevin Sinclair during Multan Test: Come to the graveyardPakistan wicketkeeper batter Mohammad Rizwan was seen sledging West Indies batter Kevin Sinclair during day 2 of the first Test between the two teams in Multan.

Australian Open: Aryna Sabalenka reaches quarters by dominating Mirra AndreevaAryna Sabalenka swept aside the challenge from Mirra Andreeva with ease as she progressed to the quarterfinals of the Australian Open 2025 with a straight sets win on Sunday, January 19. Sabalenka defeated the Russian teenager in just 1 hour and 2 minutes.

Karnataka win record 5th title after 36-run win over VidarbhaVijay Hazare Trophy: Karnataka won their record-extending 5th title after a superb 36-run win over Vidarbha in the final at the Kotambi Stadium in Vadodara.

Rohit, Ajit name India squad; break silence on BCCI's 10-point diktatChampions Trophy 2025: Captain Rohit Sharma and chairman of selectors Ajit Agarkar addressed a press conference in Mumbai to announce India's 15-member squad for the ICC tournament. Rohit and Agarkar also broke silence on BCCI's 10-point diktat to contracted players.

PAK vs WI, 1st Test: Noman, Sajid hunt in pair as Pakistan dominate day 2Pakistan vs West Indies: Sajid Khan and Noman Ali shared nine wickets amongst themselves to help Pakistan bowl West Indies out for 137 and take a 93-run lead in the first innings of the first Test in Multan.

Watch: Kartik Aaryan applauds Murlikant Petkar as he's conferred with Arjuna AwardBollywood actor Kartik Aaryan was spotted applauding former Para-athlete Murlikant Rajaram Petkar as he got conferred with the prestigious Arjuna Award. Aaryan protrayed Petkar's role in the movie 'Chandu Champion'.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
